column4: Hello again! I just tried rsync, but had no luck with it to copy my home folder to usb hdd. Previously, I tried cp -fr and cp-a and even tar cvpjf. No luck! Please, help! Either some files are not allowed to be copied or are too big for tar.
what was the specific command you used?
yes: too big file and some are not allowed to be copied. I even logout and did everything as root, from console
what sort of filesystem is on the USB HDD?  ext3?  ntfs?  fat?
fat32 has a 4GB limit for file transfers
not stupid - I had to learn that too :-)
Then, I just need to make ext3 fs?
do you need it to be visible on Windows (or Mac)?
if not, ext3 would be ideal
Yes, I would prefer that, although I use Linux only and VirutalBox Win XP for some compatibility with my colleagues
it *looks like* the rsync option would be --exclude='.VirtualBox' if you wanted to (see man rsync
H__, THANKS A LOT! So, I should do: rsync -a --exclude=.VirtualBox? rsync is better than cp?
that should work - yes, rsync is better (designed for what you're doing), and you're welcome
